modName: Light in Darkness v3 - My injFX_Settings for RCRN  v2 - v3
summary:
This is a re-balancing of the light and dark values in the game, and a re-balancing of colors to reflect real world values without exaggerating Saturation.

Using  RCRN 3.1 Pure and RCRN 2.1 Classic.
descriptionHtml:
Light in the Darkness 3.2 - For RCRN 3.1 Pure, and RCRN 2.1 Classic

Light in Darkness v3.2, CTD fix for both files.
____________________________________________________________________________________

Their are two different files this time:

 Light in Darkness v3.2 injFX_Settings for RCRN Pure v3.1

Light in Darkness v3.2 injFX_Settings for RCRN Classic v2.1

Make sure you chose wisely ;) 

I believe, Light in Darkness v3.2 injFX_Settings for RCRN Classic v2.1,  is the better of the two.
The best work I\'ve done yet!

Anyways Enjoy

Easier to manage dungeons less gloom but still challenging.
Little brighter roads at night, depending on weather.

___________________________________________________________________________________ 

This Mod is an attempt to capture real world values of light, dark, shadow, ambient light and color.

The light and dark values are balanced with the time of day. So night feels like real world night but not unrealistically dark for a game. Bright days are just that. Mornings and dusk  will feel more realistic 

The ambient light is balanced in a way that allows nights to get very dark. However, night time ambient light values are dependent on how dark the night is. A night with both moons out and the northern lights dancing in the sky, will be a brighter night then one with out those light sources. Makes the game more realistic when there are different degrees of darkness at night, and torches now have value.

Shadows and interiors will feel more balanced and realistic.

Light in the Darkness: better visibility in darkness because of real light values. Light from torches and other light sources reach deeper into darkness in a realistic way without adding unrealistic color tints.

Colors have been rebalanced a well.
____________________________________________________________________________________

Here are a few must have mods I use.

Real Rain

Quieter World (Quieter Dungeons, Quieter Winds)
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12621
Remove Ambient Interior Fog
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9571

These Mods for enhancing the darker nights.

Lanterns On The Roads
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10143
Mystically Illuminated Glowing Signs
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15664
Glowing Ore Veins 300
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15657
Torches For Skyrim
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15648
Real Effect Candle
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7643
____________________________________________________________________________________

Permissions   

Anyone can use my mod adjustments for for anything they want, where ever they want.
____________________________________________________________________________________

INSTILLATION
-----------------
Install RCRN 3.1 Pure 

Put My Light in Darkness v3.2 Pure version, injFX_Settings.h  file into the main Skyrim folder replacing RCRN 3.1 Pure version. 

OR

Install RCRN 2.1 Classic

Put My Light in Darkness v3.2 Classic version, injFX_Settings.h  file into the main Skyrim folder replacing RCRN 2.1Classic version

I\'ve included copy\'s of my ini files as well.

enjoy
____________________________________________________________________________________

Light in Darkness v3.2 injFX_Settings for RCRN Classic v2.1, is not designed for RCRN 3.1 or the other way around.
____________________________________________________________________________________
